passage_text: the main difference between an annual salary and an hourly wage is that a person must work to get paid when he is getting an hourly wage for instance a person working 40 hours one week and 20 hours the next will get paid for 60 hours of work when on

if you are paid on an hourly basis you need to calculate your annual salary based on the number of hours you work in a year for example if you work 40 hours per week you would multiply 40 by 52 to get 2080 annual hours you would then multiply this by your hourly wage to get an

physician assistants raked in a median annual salary of $ 92970 in 2013 according to the bls the top earning 10 percent in the profession made approximately $ 130620 while the lowest 10 percent of the pay spectrum brought in about $ 62030

for example if you earn $ 45000 per year that s what you ll think of as your annual wages or salary however your wages or salary doesn t encompass all of your compensation especially if you work full time and for a large established company

number of paid hours per week average number of hours you are paid for each work week number of days you work per week average number of days you work during each week annual salary this is what your hourly pay translates into per year hourly pay x hours per week x 52 14

number of hours per day average number of hours you work per work day number of days you work per week average number of days you work during each week hourly pay this is what your annual salary translates into per hour annual salary hours per day x hours days per week x 52 14

if you are a salaried employee you can calculate your annual salary by simply multiplying your regular pay by the number of pay periods in the year for example if you are paid every two weeks you would multiply your biweekly salary by 26 if you are paid weekly you would multiply by 52

your annual salary is the amount that you will get paid in a year assuming you work the entire year at that salary for example if you are paid semi monthly such as us military pay 1st and 15th of each month and your annual salary is $ 24000 your gross paycheck before taxes will be $ 2000

daily this is what your annual salary translates into per day hourly pay x hours per day weekly this is what your annual salary translates into per week daily x days per week monthly this is what your annual salary translates into per month annual 12

if you earn $ 19 per hour then calculate your annual salary with the equation 32 5 x $ 19 x 52 $ 32110 keep track of your weekly hours with spreadsheet software or a time tracking app some time tracking apps are marketed to managers who have to keep track of hours for multiple employees
